I had a one night stopover in Bangkok on a flight between Paris and Melbourne, and chose this hotel as it was mentioned in an article I found on the internet. Bangkok is huge, I hadn't been for a while and I wanted somewhere nice but reasonably priced and easy to get to.. I knew I'd be tired after the flight from France. It's the tallest or one of the tallest (?) buildings in the city. This hotel is very close, just a little walk, from the SkyTrain station. It was busy, and obviously popular which is always a good sign - and has a skydeck so or course people can visit without having to actually be a guest in the hotel. The hotel itself is big and spacious and the staff were patient, professional and kind. I had a late flight on to Melbourne, which was a while after checkout, and so I wasn't quite sure what to do.. as it was summer I knew I'd be a hot and sweaty mess from walking around during the day and didn't want to get on the flight like that! Not to worry.. even though I'd checked out - when I came back to pick up my bags, the hotel very kindly let me use the swimming / spa area for a quick shower and freshen up before continuing my journey! (Hot tip, it would have been smarter to then take a cab to the airport as of course it was so hot I was still a sweaty mess after walking to the train and travelling in that way! Quite funny! but nice to be able to freshen-up regardless).

This Hotel has a marvellous view from all levels, and well worth going up to the very top if you have time - the deck rotates around the tower! The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and generous, with all sorts of delicious food and a beautiful view out the windows across Bangkok. I thought this hotel was a lot of fun, easy to get to, good value for money and perfect for what I needed. I'm glad I discovered it and I'd be very happy to stay there again.
